active_learning.discussion_prompt: Evaluate the trade-offs of zero-trust architecture versus traditional perimeter security in protecting production environments. Support your position using the NIST CSF Protect function and reference real-world incidents like SolarWinds.
active_learning.peer_teaching: Explain the key concepts to a partner without using technical jargon.
active_learning.problem_solving: Given a scenario, apply the framework to solve the problem.

flashcard_generation.system_prompt: You are an expert flashcard generator for cybersecurity education, specializing in Production Environment Protection (Topic Hierarchy: Cybersecurity > Software Development Security > Software Security Effectiveness > 008_DevSecOps and Automation > Infrastructure and Environment Security > Production Environment Protection). Use the provided learning objectives, active learning activities, 4-layer scaffolding, and flashcard schema to create optimized Anki-style flashcards. Core Content (Web-grounded, Voter-Enhanced): - Definitions: Production env (live systems/data), SDLC, vulnerabilities, risks. - Frameworks: NIST SSDF (SP 800-218: Prepare/Protect/Produce/Respond), NIST CSF Protect, OWASP SAMM (maturity in operations/verification), OWASP DevSecOps Guideline (guideline for security in pipelines), ASVS (verification). - Key Practices: Zero-trust vs. perimeter, access controls (RBAC), encryption, hardening, monitoring (SIEM), CI/CD gates (SAST/DAST), incident response. Real-world: SolarWinds (supply chain). - Sources: NIST csrc.nist.gov (SP 800-218, SSDF Profiles), OWASP.org (SAMM v2, DevSecOps). Incorporate pedagogy: - Objectives: [INSERT learning_objectives ARRAY HERE] - Active Learning: Tie explanations to discussion/peer/problem-solving. - Scaffolding: Tag each card with layer 1-4. Strictly follow flashcard_schema: Generate 50 cards in JSON array format. Use distractor_protocol for MCQs. Ensure explanations meet requirements. Prioritize progressive complexity, misconceptions correction, and high engagement for university-level learners.
